Put your face in photos and videos using the front and main cameras

Recording has stopped due to low battery. Charge your device and try again.
Resolution for the following capturing modes has been changed to 13 MP (4:3) because of a Software update
Burst capturing stopped due to out of memory. Delete some files to clear some space on the internal storage.

You can record videos even in high contrast scene, and make them more dramatic and closer to what you see in real life. Please use supported devices/services to enjoy the content with its original colour and brightness.

Partial colour
The device temperature is rising. If it continues to rise, the app will close automatically.
Camera will now turn off temporarily to cool down.
Internal storage is corrupt or write-protected. Data storage changed to SD card.
Memory full. Delete some files from SD card or internal storage.
Swipe the screen to switch to another capturing mode, such as Video or Manual, and switch between the main and front camera.
Make sure that you hold your device still

Single auto focus

"Cannot start app. Make sure that the latest version of %1$s is installed and enabled on your device."
Turn your palm towards the camera. Self-timer will be turned on when your palm is recognised. To help with recognition, extend your fingers upwards.
Turn your palm towards the camera
Image stabiliser
Image stabiliser
Stay at least 1 metre away from the object when taking photos with dual camera on. Getting close to the object may cause a shift of the viewpoint or colour.

Cannot connect with a Sony Wi-Fi/NFC camera when your Xperia is connected with another Xperia.
Only one Sony Wi-Fi/NFC camera can be connected with your Xperia at a time.

Cannot connect with another Xperia when your Xperia is connected with a Sony Wi-Fi/NFC camera.
Centre

"The camera has been launched automatically by detecting your motion of lifting up your phone in landscape mode and aiming it towards an object. You can select your favourite way to use this feature from Smart launch in camera settings."
Tap inside the circle to view full screen

"You can launch the camera quickly. Swiftly lift your device in landscape mode and aim the camera towards an object. The camera will be launched automatically. You can select your favourite way to use this feature from Smart launch in camera settings."

"You can launch the camera quickly. Swing your device up in landscape mode and aim the camera towards an object. The camera will be launched automatically. You can turn off this feature from Smart launch in camera settings."
Front camera only
Reset colour and brightness
This setting is not supported for the current resolution or scene. To configure this setting, change the resolution or scene selection.
This setting is not supported for the current scene. To configure this setting, change the scene selection.
Unable to change video size in slow-motion mode. To configure this setting, exit slow-motion mode.
This setting is not supported for the current video resolution or scene. To configure this setting, change the video resolution or scene selection.
To retrieve locations
To record sounds
Soft Skin
Auto-capturing
"Instantly record a precious moment in %1$s fps slow motion by tapping the button in the centre of the screen. Recording in bright conditions will help you create a better video."
You can record a right moment with %1$s fps by tapping the centre button
Instantly record a precious moment in %1$s fps slow motion by tapping the button in the centre of the screen
Record a video and then edit it to make select parts in slow motion. Tap the button in centre of the screen to set the parts as slow motion.
Tap the button in the centre at the right moment
Tap the button in the centre of the screen to record in slow motion. Tap the Stop button to stop recording.
Soft Skin Effect
Colour
Software Licences
Front camera only
For stable 4K video recording, you must not change this setting unless you use a high-speed SD card (UHS Speed Class 1 or higher, or Speed Class 10 are recommended).
"For stable slow-motion video recording, don't change this setting unless you use a high-speed SD card (UHS Speed Class 1 or higher, or Speed Class 10 are recommended)."

"For stable video recording, we recommend that you change data storage to Internal storage. Would you like to change now?
If you continue to use SD card as data storage, make sure that you use a high-speed SD card (UHS Speed Class 1 or higher, or Speed Class 10 recommended)."
Keep at least 1 metre away from the object when recording with dual camera. Getting close to the object may cause a shift of the view point or colour when recording in Ultra-high sensitivity.
To take great close-up photos, tap No and switch to single camera. You can change it back to dual camera at any time by tapping the button on the viewfinder.
File format (4K)
Auto-capturing (video)
Video stabiliser
